Abstract:
Japanese red-cap Caesarâs mushroom, âTamagotakeâ, formerly
identified as Amanita hemibapha was taxonomically reevaluated.
Morphological characteristics of Japanese A. hemibapha specimens
corresponded to the lectotype of A. caesareoides, but not to the isotype
of A. hemibapha. Phylogenetic analysis of rDNA ITS region showed that
Japanese A. hemibapha specimens formed a single clade with the lectotype
of A. caesareoides, which positioned adjacently to A. caesarea and A.
jacksonii. A Thai A. hemibapha specimen that was morphologically
corresponded to the isotype of A. hemibapha grouped with its Indian
specimens and showed a distant clade from A. caesareoides. Therefore, it
is concluded that Japanese red-cap Caesarâs mushroom is A.
caesareoides.
